resources.string: Do you feel sad most of the time?
Did you lose interest in most of the enjoyable things for you?
Are you always tired, always have low energy and you always struggle to accomplish everything on your daily "to do" list?
Is it hard to find the motivation to do anything including going out with friends or completing tasks?
Do you feel anxious and worried about little things in life?
Do you have negative thoughts and feelings of anger often playing themselves in your mind?
Do you feel restless, irritable and often lash out at the people who are closest to you?
Can it be difficult to fall asleep or stay asleep – regardless of how tired you may be?
Do you find it\'s hard to concentrate on anything and you are more forgetful than ever?
Do you have headaches, backaches, joint pain and other physical ailments that you can’t pin-point the problem and don’t respond to regular treatments?
Do you feel Some days that you are sad or guilty about the things you haven’t done?
Do you feel lonely even when there is a room full of people around you and often worry that no one really likes you?
Have you problems with your weight and you are starting to feel overwhelmed by your own life?
Do you have auditory or visual hallucinations ?
Did you think of or tried to hurt yourself or commit suicide ?

Depression (major depressive disorder) is a common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act. Fortunately, it is also treatable. Depression causes feelings of sadness and/or a loss of interest in activities once enjoyed. It can lead to a variety of emotional and physical problems and can decrease a person’s ability to function at work and at home.
